intro: Lomandra micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lomandra, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in dense spikes, typically blooming in spring. It is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments. Lomandra micrantha is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that is popular in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
